etymology.description: Pictogram: a short-tailed bird (e.g., a sparrow). Compare 鳥.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a small bird with a short tail, contrasting with 鳥, which shows a longer-tailed bird. It later serves as a component signaling ‘bird’ semantics in many compounds.

examples.chinese: 这个字写作“隹”，表示短尾鸟，如麻雀等(這個字寫作「隹」，表示短尾鳥，如麻雀等)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège zì xiězuò “zhuī”, biǎoshì duǎnwěi niǎo, rú máquè děng.
examples.english: This graph is written as “隹” and denotes a short-tailed bird, such as a sparrow.

examples.chinese: 与“鳥”相比，“隹”强调尾巴短，小而敏捷(與「鳥」相比，「隹」強調尾巴短，小而敏捷)。
examples.pinyin: Yǔ “niǎo” xiāngbǐ, “zhuī” qiángdiào wěiba duǎn, xiǎo ér mǐnjié.
examples.english: Compared with 鳥, 隹 emphasizes a short tail and a small, nimble bird.

examples.chinese: 在构形中，隹常作语素部件，用来表意；如集、雁、雄等字都含有它(在構形中，隹常作語素部件，用來表意；如集、雁、雄等字都含有它)。
examples.pinyin: Zài gòuxíng zhōng, zhuī cháng zuò yǔsù bùjiàn, yònglái biǎoyì; rú jí, yàn, xióng děng zì dōu hányǒu tā.
examples.english: In character formation, 隹 often serves as a semantic component meaning “bird”; characters like 集, 雁, and 雄 contain it.
